TwitchIO¶

Client¶

class twitchio.client.Client(nick: str, token: str, initial_channels: (<class 'list'>, <class 'tuple'>, <built-in function callable>), **attrs)¶
run(pre_run=None)¶

A blocking call that initializes the event loop.

This should be the last function to be called.

coroutine get_chatters(channel: str)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Method which attempts to retrieve the current viewers for the provided channel.

Parameters:channel (str) – The channel name to retrieve viewer data from.
Returns:A json containing the channels viewer data.
Return type:json
rate_status¶

The current rate limit status.

If the bot has Moderator status on all current connected channels, this will return Full else Restricted.

Returns:status – Full/Restricted
Return type:str
coroutine auth_seq(channels=None)¶

Automated Authentication process.

Attempts to authenticate on the Twitch servers with the provided nickname and IRC Token(pass).

On successful auth, an attempt to join the provided channels is made.

coroutine event_error(error_name, *args, **kwargs)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Default error handler for the TwitchIO Client.

This could be overridden to implement custom error handling.

coroutine event_join(user)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Event called when a JOIN is received from Twitch.

Parameters:user (User) – User object containing relevant information to the JOIN.
coroutine event_message(message)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Event called when a PRIVMSG is received from Twitch.

Parameters:message (Message) – Message object containing relevant information.
coroutine event_mode(channel, user, status)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Event called when a MODE is received from Twitch.

Parameters:
  • channel (Channel) – Channel object relevant to the MODE event.
  • user (User) – User object containing relevant information to the MODE.
  • status (str) – The JTV status received by Twitch. Could be either o+ or o-. Indicates a moderation promotion/demotion to the .User.
coroutine event_part(user)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Event called when a PART is received from Twitch.

Parameters:user (User) – User object containing relevant information to the PART.
coroutine event_raw_data(data)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Event called when any message or notification is received from Twitch.

This should be used sparingly, and only when needed, as the client already aims to break this down for you.

Parameters:data (str) – The raw data received from Twitch. Decoded as UTF-8.
coroutine event_ready()¶

This function is a coroutine.

Event called when the Client has successfully authenticated on the Twitch server.

coroutine event_userstate(user)¶

This function is a coroutine.

Event called when a USERSTATE is received from Twitch.

Parameters:user (User) – User object containing relevant information to the USERSTATE.
host¶

Host address used to connect the IRC Server.

coroutine join_channels(channels: (<class 'list'>, <class 'tuple'>))¶

Attempt to join the provided channels.

Parameters:channels (list or tuple) – A list of channels to attempt joining.
nick¶

Username used to connect to the IRC Server.

port¶

Port used to connect to the IRC Server.

coroutine send_auth()¶

Send a PASS request to Twitch.

Should only be used if :.auth_seq: was not used.

coroutine send_nick()¶

Send a NICK request to Twitch.

Should only be used if :.auth_seq: was not used.
